history.content:
Hi! I took STAT 28 this semester. For reference, I have taken DATA 8 as well, and plan to take DS 100 in the coming year.

I felt that the course material in STAT 28 is very useful and directly applicable to many data science use-cases, as we learn to program in R and use the various libraries in it. The course explores many ideas in statistical inference such as hypothesis testing, group comparisons using ANOVA and logistic regression. We also learn to build models using decision trees and random forests. I felt that organization and delivery of the course material needed improvement, but that might be a result of Spring 2017 being the pilot offering.

To the best of my knowledge, DS 100 would have already taught you a lot of techniques that are used in the real world, and taking STAT 28 would only be beneficial if you want to learn R and some more statistical methods. 

Also, I'm not sure if it is being offered again this Fall, so you might want to check that.

children.subject: Thanks! And yep, not offered in the Fall :/

history.content: Has anyone taken Stat 28? If so, how was it? I've taken DS100 and Data8 as well, for reference, and trying to build up my mathematical maturity for 189 next Spring.
history.subject: Stat 28 Experience
